title: Best over-the-range microwaves

description: An over-pressure cooker is a great option if you're short on counter space or want a sleek, streamlined look in your kitchen. A new over-the-range (OTR) microwave may be purchased for as low as $200 (not counting installation costs, which can add another $100 or more). If the price of your new microwave is above a particular threshold, some stores, like Home Depot, will install it for free. The downsides should not be ignored, however. Even while over-the-range microwaves include an exhaust fan, they are not as effective at removing odors and fumes from the kitchen as range hoods. Also, if your microwave is more than 18 inches above your stove, you could have trouble reaching it to retrieve a steaming cup of soup.

content_list.content:
Over-the-range microwaves are space-saving appliances that may be installed over your range. A built-in ventilation system usually helps keep the kitchen clean while you cook. It's a miracle worker that eliminates greasy smells and frees up counter space in your kitchen. The finest microwaves for placing over a range allow you to save valuable counter space while whipping up delicious meals in record time. And under microwaves are not to be mistaken with the provided with appropriate microwaves; rather, they are placed directly over the stove instead of the finest range hoods (opens to a new tab).

All the functions of a regular microwave oven may be performed by an over-the-range microwave, whether defrosting expensive portions of meat to whipping up a fast lunch on a weekday. However, it also has several handy features that make it a welcome addition to any contemporary kitchen. This appliance is perfect for those who wish to give their kitchen a modern makeover, make better use of their available space, or replace an outdated model.

1. LG LMHM2237ST



The Monument Grills 77352 is a fantastic barbecue with many useful features and a large cooking area at an affordable price.

Specification

● MODE OF CONVECTION: No

● SENSOR: Yes

● GRILL: No

Pros

+ Sensor Cook

+ Built-in ventilation

+ 400 CFM fan speed

Cons

− Expensive

− Small clock


One of the greatest and under microwaves (opens into a new tab) is the LG LMHM2237ST. It has one of the greatest capacities of any microwave we've tested, making it a good choice for households with many people or for individuals who often use their microwave to heat large trays or plates. However, at the cost of roughly $500, it is far more costly than the devices we've previously tested. Please continue reading to determine whether we believe it's a good investment. The LG LMHM2237ST over-the-range microwave is among the most expensive options we considered, but it offers a lot of useful functions for its price. To begin, let's talk about how much stuff you can store. With a spacious interior measuring 2.2 cubic feet, this microwave is the largest we looked at.

The LG LMHM2237ST's 1000 kW electric electricity is about par for the course; the cheaper Samsung ME16K3000AS offers the same amount of juice. This over-the-range microwave, however, stands out thanks to its variable speed fan. When compared to the other models, we looked at. The LG LMHM2237ST stands out because of its 400 CFM fan speed.

The LG LMHM2237ST has strong ventilation, known as ExtendaVent 2.0, which is designed to remove smells and fumes from the cooktop underneath it. This ventilation system is meant to be low-noise so as not to be too annoying. The LG LMHM2237ST has ten touch-controlled power settings, but its Sensor Cook feature is where it shines. The sensor in the cooktop measures the moisture emanating from the meal. This microwave will automatically shut off when the desired moisture content is reached, preventing either overcooking or drying out of your food.
content_list.subtitle: Best over-the-range microwaves

content_list.content:
2. GE JVM3160RFSS



Over-the-range microwaves don't get much better than the GE JVM3160RFSS, which is packed with convenient functions and looks fantastic.

Specification

● Weight: 61. 9 pounds

● Installation: Over the Range:

● Capacity: 1.6 Cu. Ft.

Pros

+ Two-speed fan.

+ Turntable turn-off function.

Cons

− There is no sensor function for cooking.


The GE JVM3160RFSS can heat or thaw 1.6 cubic feet of food with minimal user intervention. This model, which we reviewed as part of our selection of the best over-the-range microwaves (opens in new tab), is not the cheapest available, but it does include some thoughtful and helpful features. The GE JVM3160RFSS is a high-end over-the-range microwave that almost makes our top picks list. Similar to the Samsung ME16K3000AS (opens in new tab), but at a lower price point, this microwave includes a two-speed fan that operates at 300 cubic feet per minute (CFM).

The microwave's quick-cook features set it apart from other models placed over the stove. The six numbered buttons enable you to start a cycle of any length between one and six minutes with the press of a single button. This is definitely an improvement compared to its rivals, which only featured three rapid cook buttons. Even if you don't plan on eating the food immediately, the warm power option will preserve it at a safe temperature until you're ready. That won't replace the official warm and hold button, but it will do in a pinch.

With the microwaves we looked at, only the GE JVM3160RFSS offers customization in terms of color and finish. We've emphasized the sleek stainless steel finish seen here, but you may also choose from four additional colors to find the perfect complement to your kitchen's aesthetic. The clock and non-stick interior are two more noteworthy design elements. This microwave's non-stick coating and compact digital clock are welcome additions.

content_list.content:
3. Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF



Having a large interior and sensor cooking, the Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF is a great choice for an over-the-range microwave.

Specification

● WATTS: 1000

● DETAILED PROMPTS: Yes

● GRILL: No

Pros

+ Internal rack.

+ Sensor cooking.

Cons

− Larger capacities are available.

− Beeps until you cancel it.


This large Frigidaire Gallery is 1.7 cu. Ft. or under the microwave, product code FGMV17WNVF makes reheating any dish a snap with more than 30 cooking settings and several 1-Touch features. The microwave's Effortless Smooth Interior deemed effective cleanup quick and easy after any mishap. Preparing and cooking meals is facilitated with LED lighting that gives a clear, bright view of the stove. You may find them on AppliancesConnection.com today.

In terms of the best under microwaves, Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF seems to be a strong candidate because of its huge size and sleek contemporary appearance. It has a decent 1.7 cubic feet of room, but the LG LMHM2237ST's 2.2 cubic feet may very well be preferable for more spacious houses. At over $390, model Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF represents one of the most expensive over-the-range microwaves we researched. This model may not be the cheapest microwave oven out there, but it offers a lot of bang for the buck thanks to its many advanced features.

The sensor's heating features inside the Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF make it a great microwave. The Frigidaire stands out since it is the only microwave we evaluated with this feature. The key to sensor cooking is keeping an eye on the food's moisture levels while it prepares.

The microwave will automatically adapt the cooking time based on the food's specific demands. The Frigidaire Gallery FGMV17WNVF has a large turntable, but you may disable it if you're microwaving anything that could otherwise hit the edge of the unit. The added safety lock is a nice touch.

content_list.content:
4. ZLINE MWO-OTR-30



This ZLINE MWO-OTR-30 over-the-range microwave has all the bells and whistles you could want in a high-end microwave.

Specification

● Brand: Z Line Kitchen and Bath

● Color: Stainless Steel

● Material: Stainless Steel

Pros

+ Powerful.

+ The Rise of "Sensor Cooking".

Cons

− Within the microwave, which results in condensation.

− Things don't heat up that soon.


The ZLINE MWO-OTR-30 is a high-powered, aesthetically pleasing microwave oven. Even though it performed well in our tests, it was one of the most costly models we looked at, so if you're on a tight budget and need a microwave badly, check out our recommendations for the best over-the-range microwaves (opens in new tab). The ZLINE MWO-OTR-30 over-the-range microwave's 1.5 cubic feet is sufficient in terms of capacity. Although it's not as large as the LG LMHM2237ST (opens in a new tab), it's still better than many of the devices we looked at.

At roughly $600, though, this microwave is among the more expensive over-the-range options. This model boasts 1500 watts, making it more powerful than most of the microwaves we looked at, which had approximately 1000 watts. The range hood/ventilator hybrid ZLINE MWO-OTR-30 has a CFM rating of 300. That's about par for an above-the-range microwave, but more robust fans are available if desired. This over-the-range microwave offers sensor cooking and all the standard cooking capabilities, including auto-defrost.

The ZLINE MWO-OTR-30 has a reflecting diamond design called Diamond Tech on the inside. This method ensures that your food is cooked uniformly, with no hot or cold spots. Compared to the more affordable microwaves we looked at, the ZLINE MWO-two-year OTR-30's components guarantee seems a little short.

content_list.content:
5. Samsung MS14K6000AS



For its modest cost, the Dyna-Glo 4-Burner Gas Grill has a large cooking area and four powerful burners.

Specification

● WATTS: 1000

● DETAILED PROMPTS: No

● TYPE: Large countertop microwaves

Pros

+ Modern sensor cooking.

+ Child safety lock.

+ Eco mode.

Cons

− No grilling element.


When shopping for a microwave, cooking capacity is one of the most important features. Since a microwave's power output is directly proportional to its efficiency, this factor affects how long it may take to prepare a meal. The MS14K6000AS's 1000 Watts are more than plenty. It will cook a broad variety of dishes at around the same pace as the 1000 Watt Samsung ME19R7041FS microwave, but it won't hold as much as that model. When comparing the ME19R7041FS to the MS24K6000AS, the former has a more spacious 1.9 cubic feet.

The Samsung MS14K6000AS microwave, like its sibling, the Samsung MS19M8000AS-AA, is proof of this. In addition, it is backed by a one-year and ten-year guarantee. The magnetron, the heart of every microwave oven, is covered by a 10-year warranty, while the rest of the appliance is guaranteed for 2 years. This countertop microwave has a capacity of 1.4 cubic feet, and its inside is coated with ceramic enamel, making it easy to clean and scratch-proof. This ensures that it will continue to appear brand new for a long period after purchase.

The MS14K6000 microwave oven is one example of a contemporary microwave with premium user friendliness. With its intuitive layout and streamlined selection of touch-screen buttons, this device is a breeze to use. Even though it only comes in a black stainless steel finish, we believe you'll find it beautiful and a perfect addition to your kitchen since it boasts a blue-lit LED display like the Samsung MC12J8035CT
content_list.subtitle: null

content_list.content: The microwave has become an indispensable kitchen tool for several reasons, including defrosting, thawing, and reheating food. You can prepare popcorn in a few minutes, thaw out last week's lasagna, or reheat your coffee without starting a fresh pot. Over-the-range microwaves provide a few advantages over both traditional countertop units and the newest drawer microwaves. In addition to freeing up space on your countertops, these devices may also function as range hoods, and with so many options, you shouldn't have any trouble finding one that goes well with your current cookware and decor.
content_list.subtitle: Conclusion
